title: Happier study, easier pass with our FREE GED PRACTICE TEST!
description: Our free practice test for the GED test can help you identify which areas you need to brush up on before test day.
content:
The GED test is consist of 4 subjects, broken into separate exams: Math, Reasoning Through Language Arts, Science, and Social study. These tests are designed to ensure that individuals who earn their GED have the skills and knowledge equivalent to high school graduates. You don’t have to take all 4 tests at once - you can space them out however it suits you and go at your own pace.

Our thousands of FREE GED PRACTICE QUESTIONS and tests will ensure that you are completely prepared, taking you to the right direction to passing your TEAS. We divide each knowledge domains into small parts. All you need to do is taking your study round by round as a mini game with fully detailed explanations for each questions!

Practice with us and get the resources you need to succeed on your first try!

There are 4 sections in the GED exam:

·       Mathematics – The math test is taken by all applicants by 115-minute test in length. Two main components of the Mathematics GED test are Algebraic problem solving and quantitative problem solving. An on-screen calculator is allowed during the Math section of the GED test. Do not bring your own calculator from home.

·       English and Language Usage – You will have 150 minutes to finish this section. This test concentrates on assessing a student's reading and writing skills. Questions are concerned with the Reading for Meaning, Identifying and Creating Arguments, Grammar and Language.

·       Social study: This is the shortest test of 4 GED tests within 70 minutes. The Social Studies GED exam covers 4 main topics. You will be tested on your knowledge of economics, U.S. history, civics and government and geography and the world. The civics and government test questions make up 50% of the test. Twenty percent of the test covers U.S. history, and the remainder of the test is divided between economics and geography and the world

·       Science: In this section, you will have 90 minutes to complete the test. The GED Science test covers three major topics: Reading for Meaning in Science, Designing and Interpreting Science Experiments, Using Numbers and Graphics in Science.

 

About TEAS exam

Is GED test hard?

The GED test is hard because it is very time-pressured. But if you prepare with good resources, the GED is quite easy. The GED test gives you limited time (from 70 to 150 minutes, depending on the subject) for around 35-40 questions per subject. The GED test is also easy because it is NOT tricky. The GED is a pretty straightforward test; you can easily get ready for it in a few weeks or months (depending on your educational background). Many GED test-takers end up feeling that they could have done much better if they only had more time.

 

Is GED math hard?

The GED test can be more difficult than exams in high school. It would require you to make use of your critical thinking abilities instead of just memorizing the facts. The questions do not merely require “yes” or “no” answers. You'll need to connect various concepts, analyze specific data and make inferences as well.

 

Can I take my GED test online at home?

No, you cannot take the GED test online. You may take preparation courses on the Internet, but you can only take the GED test in a GED testing service center. The GED test is generally administered on a computer, but you cannot take it online at home from your computer.

 

How to pass the GED test?

The bulk of what you'll need to know for the GED test is tied to the foundational education subjects commonly found in high school curriculums. The test covers material that students are expected to have acquired from their secondary education in the following areas: Reading, Mathematics, Social study, English.

There is a lot to know and our free practice test for the DMV test will help you find out where you need to work more and make the most of your study time.
